title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:00 <lpereira> has quit  
00:27 <fmancinelli> has quit  
00:54 <abusenius> has quit  
04:29 <DrLou> has quit  
07:12 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:12 <cjdelisl1> has quit  
07:12 <npm> has quit  
07:12 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
07:12 <pgmjsd> has quit  
07:12 <JuanDaugherty> has quit  
07:13 <pturcotte> has quit  
07:13 <heeere> has quit  
07:13 <sburjan`> has quit  
07:13 <xipe> has quit  
07:14 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
07:14 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
07:14 <JuanDaugherty> has joined #xwiki  
07:14 <cjdelisl1> has joined #xwiki  
07:14 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
07:14 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
07:14 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
07:14 <heeere> has joined #xwiki  
07:14 <pgmjsd> has joined #xwiki  
07:14 <xipe> has joined #xwiki  
07:53 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:54 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
07:55 <jstoldt> has quit  
07:56 <sdumitriu> vmassol: I wonder if https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-repository/ must be released  
07:56 <sdumitriu> I haven't done that for M3 and RC-1  
07:57 <sdumitriu> I'm done with the 3.2 release notes, just doing a final read, can you check them as well?  
08:02 <vmassol> Hi sdumitriu. Hmmm…. We need to ask Thomas. Personally I'd like to remove it  
08:03 <vmassol> because IMO we're going the other way, ie make stuff installable as extensions instead of having distributions  
08:03 <vmassol> I talked to thomas about it actually (I remember now) and what he said is that he had this distribution purely for the functional tests  
08:03 <sdumitriu> So, don't release  
08:04 <vmassol> so IMO this could possibly even be moved inside the functional tests  
08:04 <vmassol> (in XE)  
08:04 <vmassol> yes don't release now, let's wait for to hear from thomas  
08:05 <vmassol> reading RN now  
08:05 <sdumitriu> It's not a dependency for the other repositories, so I can start the release now and maybe start later the release for XR if needed  
08:05 <vmassol> yep  
08:06 <vmassol> btw I  haven't pushed the RC1 to central, need to do that  
08:07 <sdumitriu> Yes, saw that too  
08:16 <vmassol> very nice RN sdumitriu :)  
08:16 <vmassol> I think we should add the browsers that this version supports  
08:17 <sdumitriu> Yes  
08:17 <sdumitriu> But sburjan` is the one that knows that  
08:17 <vmassol> ok we'll ask him to add it  
08:18 <sdumitriu> Do you agree with the HTTPS statement?  
08:18 <vmassol> yes  
08:18 <sdumitriu> We need to add documentation for it  
08:18 <vmassol> isn't it a given?  
08:18 <sdumitriu> I can add it after I start the release (updating translations now)  
08:19 <vmassol> like we don't say that we support HTTP either  
08:19 <vmassol> where would you document that?  
08:19 <sdumitriu> In the adminguide, installation or configuration, not sure yet  
08:19 <vmassol> ok  
08:19 <sdumitriu> I mean. not that we support it, how to configure it in different ways  
08:19 <vmassol> that yes definitely  
08:19 <sdumitriu> Jetty, tomcat, mod-ajp  
08:20 <vmassol> missing explanation on how to turn off CSRF in the RN I think  
08:20 <sdumitriu> Alex said he'll do it  
08:20 <vmassol> I'd move the part about "If your application has been broken" to the bottom of hte page  
08:20 <vmassol> in the compat section  
08:22 <vmassol> good idea to do the jira dashboard thing again  
08:22 <vmassol> we forgot it for 3.1 it seems  
08:25 <sdumitriu> I can add it, but it's a bit late  
08:25 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: around ?  
08:26 <sdumitriu> Yep  
08:26 <sdumitriu> Was waiting for you  
08:26 <+tmortagne> what do you think about what Denis said on query plugin ?  
08:27 <+tmortagne> i.e. "let's remove the displaySearch methods they don't work anyway" to summarize  
08:27 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <sdumitriu> +0.9  
08:28 <+tmortagne> :)  
08:28 <sdumitriu> Missing 0.1 because it's API breakage, even if the method doesn't work at all  
08:28 <sdumitriu> We could add them in an aspect with an empty implementation  
08:28 <sdumitriu> i.e. do nothing, return empty string  
08:29 <+tmortagne> if its an aspect it does not have to be empty method but the thing is I don't know yet how to put interface method in aspect  
08:33 <+tmortagne> IMO it's either move it to aspect without touching anything but need to find how or simply remove the display method and retire, not sure it worth the effort to aspect methods that don't work. If nobody is using it it's not going to break much.  
08:34 <sdumitriu> Indeed  
08:34 <sdumitriu> So, to check, should I release XR for 3.2?  
08:35 <+tmortagne> (does not prevent me to find how to handle interface declaration since we will need it for sure sometime)  
08:36 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: I would I said yes but vmassol is not very found of adding another product so I guess we will need to discuss it during 3.3, it's not critical anyway since there is only packaging in XR like with XEM  
08:36 <+tmortagne> s/found/fond/  
08:38 <sdumitriu> OK  
08:38 <sdumitriu> Can you check the release notes, see if what I said about the extension manager is correct, and if you have something else to add?  
08:38 <sdumitriu> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise32  
08:43 <+tmortagne> sure  
08:43 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: note that I generally list all the new stuff for each version in the extension manager page  
08:44 <sdumitriu> Where's that?  
08:44 <+tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension+Module  
08:44 <+tmortagne> there is an History section  
08:45 <sdumitriu> Yes, seen it now  
08:46 <vmassol> yes I'm not fond of this new repository. We should discuss it during 3.3. So I'd prefer not to release till we've concluded on it  
08:46 <vmassol> (github repository that is)  
08:46 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: "The UI now reports the progress of ongoing actions performed by the extension manager." there is a log of what happen but there is not javascipt on UI side for the dynamic progress even if there is everything needed on backend to implement it  
08:47 <+tmortagne> not sure if you meant dynamic or not  
08:49 <+tmortagne> "transforming any XWiki instance into an extension repository" that existed already in 3.1 actually but the REST protocol has been rewritten in 3.2  
08:50 <sdumitriu> tmortagne: Can you edit that?  
08:50 <+tmortagne> I'm on it  
08:50 <vmassol> this part should link to the extension page for the Repository Application  
08:50 <sdumitriu> Thanks  
08:50 <vmassol> tmortagne: I don't see one, missing?  
08:51 <+tmortagne> vmassol: on it too  
08:51 <+tmortagne> (adding links for everything I can)  
08:51 <vmassol> ok  
08:51 <vmassol> btw where is it in platform/ ?  
08:52 <+tmortagne> looks like we don't get log here for minor edit  
08:52 <vmassol> xwiki-platform-extension-ui?  
08:52 <+tmortagne> yes as I told you the other day there is nothing in XWiki Repository product but packaging  
08:52 <+tmortagne> no that's extension manager UI  
08:53 <vmassol> re minor edits that's strange, I've seen them logged  
08:53 <+tmortagne> the server UI is in xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki  
08:53 <+tmortagne> well I just saved with save and continue  
08:53 <vmassol> for ex at 8:16 this morning here  
08:53 <vmassol> maybe it's because of the save&continue?  
08:53 <+tmortagne> it's not supposed to change the event  
08:53 <vmassol> would be interesting to check if the events are sent  
08:54 <sdumitriu> Nope, works with S&C also  
08:54 <+tmortagne> it still use XWiki#saveDoducment  
08:54 <vmassol> tmortagne: can you tell me where is the repository application in platform?  
08:54 <sdumitriu> Maybe xwikibot is a bit slow this morning  
08:54 <+tmortagne> vmassol: (08:53:25 AM) tmortagne: the server UI is in xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki  
08:55 <vmassol> ok missed the message, sorry  
08:55 <+tmortagne> ha seems to work this time  
08:55 <+tmortagne> save and continue agai  
08:56 <vmassol> found it: xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-server-ui, thanks  
08:56 <+tmortagne> weird we did not received the other one, checking if it really save something  
08:57 <+tmortagne> yep looks like the first one did not added new version  
08:57 <+tmortagne> maybe I dreamed clicking on it :)  
08:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: just to be sure, I think we need to have 2 specific extensions on extensions.xwiki.org: one for the EM Application and one for the Repository Application (in addition to the Extension Module). Do we agree?  
08:59 <vmassol> oops I'm late for my gym…got to go… bb in 1 hour  
09:00 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I guess but right now there is pretty much none actually since it's only general extension manager documentation  
09:03 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: should be all I think  
09:04 <sdumitriu> Thanks  
09:04 <sdumitriu> By the way, congratulations on taking the lead on the number of issues solved in 3.2  
09:05 <+tmortagne> did I ? :)  
09:06 <sdumitriu> Yep, check the dashboard http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=10581  
09:06 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: actually looks like you still have the bugfixing lead  
09:07 <+tmortagne> 17 new features sounds a lot but 3.2 was long  
10:08 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <vmassol> tmortagne: btw Im' not sure if we should this type of issue a new feature: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6957 ?  
10:17 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it is a new feature, that's something you could not do before  
10:17 <vmassol> so a bug fix is a new feature too?  
10:17 <vmassol> :)  
10:17 <+tmortagne> from components POV  
10:17 <vmassol> beciase you couldn't do it before either  
10:18 <vmassol> (wasn't working)  
10:18 <vmassol> just kidding  
10:18 <vmassol> everything we commit is somethng you coudl'nt do before  
10:18 <+tmortagne> I meant something you were not supposed to be able to do  
10:18 <vmassol> but yes I think we have 2 types of new features  
10:18 <vmassol> - for end users  
10:18 <vmassol> - for developers  
10:19 <vmassol> (although I woudln't call a new api a "feature")  
10:19 <sdumitriu> XWIKI-6957  
10:19 <+tmortagne> I don't see why new feature should be restrained to UI...  
10:19 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Why doesn't xwikibot fetch issues?  
10:19 <vmassol> because that's what you expect  
10:19 <vmassol> when you read "new feature"  
10:19 <+tmortagne> no that's what you expect :)  
10:20 <+tmortagne> not me  
10:20 <vmassol> want to bet?  
10:20 <vmassol> we can ask people  
10:20 <vmassol> how much are you willing to bet?  
10:20 <vmassol> (money wise)  
10:20 <+tmortagne> I expect to be able to do new things that be UI or dev  
10:20 <vmassol> :)  
10:20 <+tmortagne> XWiki is a development platform  
10:20 <vmassol> sure so you'll win  
10:20 <vmassol> still want to bet?  
10:21 <vmassol> btw  
10:21 <+tmortagne> vmassol: so what you are saying is that there can't be any new feature is thing like apache-commons basically ?  
10:21 <vmassol> xwiki is not just a dev platform  
10:21 <vmassol> for 99% of people it's a wiki  
10:21 <sdumitriu> Personally, I'd call 6957 task or at most improvement  
10:21 <vmassol> yep agreed with sdumitriu  
10:21 <+tmortagne> I did not said it was just a dev platform but I don''t agree with you its just a wiki  
10:21 <sdumitriu> Since it's an improvement of an existing component  
10:21 <vmassol> or maybe we need a "New API" jira issue  
10:21 <vmassol> but that's a bit cumbersome  
10:22 <vmassol> did I say xwiki is jsut a wiki?  
10:22 <sdumitriu> But I don't generally agree that new APIs are never new features  
10:22 <vmassol> my sentence is: "for 99% of people it's a wiki"  
10:22 <vmassol> sds   
10:22 <vmassol> agreed  
10:22 <vmassol> sdumitriu: agreed  
10:22 <vmassol> like for example the new display module is ok to be a new feature IMO  
10:22 <+tmortagne> vmassol: by saying new feature is only UI thats what you sat yes IMO  
10:23 <sdumitriu> Depends on the size of the issue, since sometimes new APIs are introduced not as the feature itself, but in support of the implementation of a new feature  
10:23 <vmassol> but adding a new api to an existing module isn't imo  
10:23 <vmassol> when thomas said that in XE 3.2 we have 17 new features it seems alot  
10:23 <vmassol> but in fact a lot of those are not new features  
10:23 <sdumitriu> vmassol: How should we call XEM now, "XWiki Enterpise Manager" or "XWiki Manager"?  
10:24 <vmassol> they're just improvmeents of existing features  
10:24 <vmassol> sdumitriu: right now the agreed naming is XWki Enterprise Manager I think  
10:24 <vmassol> I don't think we changed that  
10:24 <vmassol> (don't remember at least)  
10:24 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think we could agree that a new module is a new feature  
10:25 <+tmortagne> vmassol: what are "lot of those" ?  
10:25 <vmassol> tmortagne: but that adding a new method in an existing api isn't  
10:25 <+tmortagne> I don't think it's a valid rule, adding a new method could be a totally new stuff even if it's an existing module  
10:25 <vmassol> that's not the issue tmortagne  
10:26 <vmassol> the issue is that when you mix very large stuff with very small stuff it doesn't mean aynthing anymore  
10:26 <vmassol> you look at the "feature" tag in jira when you want to see large new stuff  
10:27 <+tmortagne> "large stuff" is not my definition of feature  
10:28 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6947 is definitley not a new feature, it's an improvement IMO  
10:28 <vmassol> same for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6926  
10:28 <vmassol> same: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6924  
10:29 <+tmortagne> I already changed XWIKI-6947  
10:29 <vmassol> btw is this a runtime feature or is only at build time: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6826  
10:29 <vmassol> ?  
10:29 <+tmortagne> I think its targeting build from what I understood  
10:29 <sdumitriu> I guess only buildtime  
10:30 <vmassol> ok I'll fix the component  
10:30 <vmassol> hecking git first  
10:30 <vmassol> yep it's in test/  
10:30 <sdumitriu> Almost done with the release...  
10:31 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: I see XR issues listed in http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=10581  
10:31 <+tmortagne> for now it's wrong I think  
10:31 <sdumitriu> Yes  
10:32 <sdumitriu> The version should be renamed  
10:32 <sdumitriu> I'll do that  
10:32 <+tmortagne> it should probably not search in all projects  
10:33 <+tmortagne> since there could be contrib project with the same version as XE but which has nothing to do with it  
10:33 <+tmortagne> ok it's only top Level, I guess it's ok  
10:33 <sdumitriu> It searches in Top Level Projects  
10:34 <+tmortagne> hmm there is top level project with difference versions  
10:34 <+tmortagne> like xeclipse  
10:35 <+tmortagne> vmassol: BTW watch is still listen in top level project, but maybe you did not finished yet moving it  
10:35 <vmassol> tmortagne: where is this?  
10:35 <+tmortagne> in top level projects  
10:35 <vmassol> link?  
10:36 <+tmortagne> jire home page  
10:36 <+tmortagne> jira  
10:36 <vmassol> oh I forgot jira  
10:36 <vmassol> doing it now  
10:37 <vmassol> done  
10:37 <vmassol> thanks for noticing it  
10:40 <+tmortagne> finally found how to put interface methods in aspect  
10:40 <+tmortagne> vmassol: what do you think about what Denis said on query plugin ?  
10:40 <vmassol> I need to read up, I haven't followed this thread actually  
10:41 <sdumitriu> Release done in about 40 seconds  
10:41 <sdumitriu> Ah, plus sending the email  
10:41 <+tmortagne> to summarize: "let's remove the displaySearch methods they don't work anyway"  
10:41 <+tmortagne> vmassol:  
10:41 <sdumitriu> I need to do that in the release script as well  
10:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: +1 to remove them but I don't know enough about whether we need to move them to legacy or not. I'd say yes to legacy  
10:42 <+tmortagne> instead of putting them to legacy  
10:42 <+tmortagne> vmassol: if we move them to legacy I don't see why we would remove them  
10:42 <vmassol> remove from oldcore I meant  
10:42 <+tmortagne> the question is either move to legacy or remove  
10:43 <vmassol> without knowing more I'd say legacy  
10:43 <+tmortagne> of course it will be moved from oldccore  
10:43 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Watch broken link on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download  
10:43 <vmassol> sdumitriu: fixing  
10:44 <vmassol> you have the lock  
10:44 <sdumitriu> It's not in the page, IIRC  
10:44 <sdumitriu> It's in an included doc  
10:44 <vmassol> right  
10:44 <vmassol> need to find it  
10:45 <vmassol> found it http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DownloadCode/DownloadOther  
10:46 <vmassol> retiring concerto in jira  
10:48 <sdumitriu> Any idea why this gives 404? http://download.forge.objectweb.org/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise-installer-windows-3.2.exe  
10:48 <sdumitriu> Could be a mirror delay issue?  
10:48 <+tmortagne> we can probably remove stuff about old plugins and applications in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DownloadCode/DownloadOther  
10:50 <sdumitriu> The link from here also fails: http://forge.ow2.org/project/download.php?group\_id=170&file\_id=17138  
10:50 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: maybe but that's the first time I see this, download used to work right after version being pushed to oW2  
10:50 <sdumitriu> I'm blaming OW2 forge problem  
10:52 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu, vmassol: could you answer in the mail about query plugin so that I can finish with it  
10:56 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok to remove the lines about old plugins and applications  in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DownloadCode/DownloadOther ?  
10:56 <+tmortagne> since they are included in platform now  
10:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok  
10:59 <vmassol> (for removing the lines)  
10:59 <vmassol> what is "http://xoffice.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Repository/WebHome#HLatestSnapshots"  
10:59 <vmassol> ?  
11:00 <vmassol> Xoffice no?  
11:00 <sburjan> has quit  
11:01 <+tmortagne> vmassol: the plugin for MS Word is called XWord, we decided of the name XOffice when we started the openoffice plugin for the GSOC  
11:01 <vmassol> the top level project is XOffice so I've renamed it  
11:05 <vmassol> sdumitriu: have you updated your release scripts with the issues found by tmortagne during RC1 release?  
11:05 <vmassol> (a lot of versions were wrong in master)  
11:05 <+tmortagne> vmassol: that's more a branch issue than a release one I think  
11:05 <sdumitriu> Not yet, but it's on my TODO list  
11:05 <vmassol> I don't know if it's part of his release script or not  
11:06 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ok  
11:06 <+tmortagne> looks like mvn branch as been executed without all the profiles  
11:06 <sdumitriu> Actually I did update one thing, the fact that the integration tests and rendering bundle weren't updated  
11:07 <sdumitriu> But I still have to check if I can update some of the variables and clirr configuration automatically  
11:08 <vmassol> sdumitriu: don't you think that the "Improvements to the Suggestion and Spotlight Search widgets" could be in the user section (instead of in the developer one) in the RN  
11:09 <vmassol> never mind  
11:09 <vmassol> it contains both but it's not that important, I was finding the screenshot nice and visual  
11:09 <vmassol> and wanted to make sure users saw it  
11:11 <vmassol> sdumitriu: why don't you use this filter for the 3.2 dashboard: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=10991 ?  
11:12 <vmassol> (the one you have now is too dangerous btw, when Xeclipse reaches version 3.2 for ex it's going to change the XE 3.2 dashboard ;))  
11:12 <sdumitriu> Because it's too long  
11:12 <vmassol> long?  
11:13 <sdumitriu> But yes, it's safer  
11:13 <vmassol> the fitler exists  
11:13 <vmassol> you can just use it  
11:13 <vmassol> instead of creating a new one  
11:18 <sdumitriu> OK, the artifacts are on OW2  
11:34 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <+Denis> cjdelisl1, sdumitriu, vmassol, ... : no comment about my latest two votes regarding database migration and document ids ? I would like to commit them today on master, if no one is opposed…  
11:40 <sdumitriu> Denis: I'd like to comment later today, but I have to sleep a little. It's 5:40 AM here  
11:40 <vmassol> Denis: sorry I didn't take the time to read it.. it was a long  mail so I parked it for later reading and haven't done so yet… I'm finishing uploading to central and I'll try to find some time after I reply to thomas mail first ;)  
11:43 <sdumitriu> Release done, good night!  
11:45 <vmassol> tmortagne: answered  
11:47 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <vmassol> 3.2RC1 pushed to central (commons/rendering)… should be there in a few hours  
11:48 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <+Denis> vmassol: ok, thanks  
11:54 <lucaa> has quit  
11:55 <evalica> has quit  
11:55 <sburjan> has quit  
12:08 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki
